title: Rocky Mountain National Park: Environmental Factors
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Environmental Factors               Environmental Factors        NPS        Mother nature is the master builder of the spectacular landscapes and intricate processes that define Rocky. We can be active stewards of the park by understanding the delicate balance that exists between mother nature and human nature.         Climate Change  The delicate balance of life in the park will be continually shaped by the climate.        Air Quality   Concentrations of invisible pollutants in the air can reach a tipping point and affect park resources.         Water Quality  Consistently monitoring water bodies throughout the park is necessary to preserve this vital resource.         Geology  The story of Rocky's foundation is still being written as time passes.        Forest Health  Maintaining natural processes from root to crown helps sustain healthy ecosystems.         Night Sky and Natural Sounds  Opportunities for star gazing and quiet solitude compete with Rocky's proximity to Colorado's Front Range.        Environmental Diseases and Pests Natural diseases are part of the built-in maintenance of Rocky's natural ecosystems.          Flood Extraordinary events can make drastic landscape changes overnight. Coming Soon         Non-native Species  Introduced species can negatively affect those that are naturally found in the park.          Human Activities  Our presence in these environments can also affect natural processes. Coming Soon
